**St. Francis Preparatory School** , commonly known as **St. Francis Prep** ,
is a private, independent [Catholic](/wiki/Roman_Catholicism "Roman
Catholicism") [college preparatory school](/wiki/College_preparatory_school
"College preparatory school") in the [Fresh
Meadows](/wiki/Fresh_Meadows,_Queens "Fresh Meadows, Queens") neighborhood of
the [New York City](/wiki/New_York_City "New York City")
[Borough](/wiki/Borough "Borough") of [Queens](/wiki/Queens "Queens"), in the
State of [New York](/wiki/New_York_\(state\) "New York \(state\)"). It is the
largest non-diocesan Catholic high school in the United States.[3] St. Francis
is run by the [Franciscan Brothers of
Brooklyn](/wiki/Franciscan_Brothers_of_Brooklyn "Franciscan Brothers of
Brooklyn"), who maintain a residence on the top floor of the school. The
school has a student body of about 2,750 students and graduates between 600
and 700 students annually.

##
History[[edit](/w/index.php?title=St._Francis_Preparatory_School&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: History")]

St. Francis Preparatory originated as St. Francis Academy, a small all-boys
high school on 300 Baltic Street in [Brooklyn, New
York](/wiki/Brooklyn,_New_York "Brooklyn, New York"), founded by the
Franciscans Brothers of Brooklyn (O.S.F.).[3] The college section became [St.
Francis College](/wiki/St._Francis_College "St. Francis College"), a private
predominantly undergraduate college in [Brooklyn
Heights](/wiki/Brooklyn_Heights "Brooklyn Heights"). It took its current name
in 1935, then moved to a larger facility in [Williamsburg,
Brooklyn](/wiki/Williamsburg,_Brooklyn "Williamsburg, Brooklyn") in 1952.[4]
The school moved to its current location in [Fresh Meadows,
Queens](/wiki/Fresh_Meadows,_Queens "Fresh Meadows, Queens") in 1974 when it
acquired the facility that formerly housed Bishop Reilly High School, a co-
educational Catholic high school. The school began admitting female students
that same year.[4] A fitness center was added recently and the science labs
are being updated.[_[citation needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed
"Wikipedia:Citation needed")_] There are currently plans to add a three-story
addition to the rear of the existing building.[_[citation
needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed "Wikipedia:Citation needed")_] The
upgrades to the art rooms will support students in the studio, digital and the
performing arts.[5]

## Co-curricular activities and
athletics[[edit](/w/index.php?title=St._Francis_Preparatory_School&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Co-curricular activities and athletics")]

St. Francis Prep has a rivalry with [Holy Cross High
School](/wiki/Holy_Cross_High_School_\(Queens\) "Holy Cross High School
\(Queens\)"), fueled particularly by their [football](/wiki/American_football
"American football") teams. Known as the "Battle of the Boulevard" due to the
two schools being located only 2 miles apart on [Francis Lewis
Boulevard](/wiki/Francis_Lewis_Boulevard "Francis Lewis Boulevard"),[6] the
rivalry between the Prep Terriers and the Holy Cross Knights has been called
"arguably the greatest rivalry in New York City football."[7]

The St. Francis Prep girls tennis team has been undefeated for 17 consecutive
years, making them 17 time CHSAA champions.[_[citation
needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed "Wikipedia:Citation needed")_] In 2015
the St. Francis Prep Varsity Handball team won their 13th consecutive CHSAA
championship (with an undefeated season).[_[citation
needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed "Wikipedia:Citation needed")_]
